page.title: 01A SUMMARY OF AREA 03600189
page.content: This survey area is situated in the lower reaches of the Severn Plain, 12 miles north of Bristol. Hence it tends to be flat and mainly given over to agriculture. Areas are known to flood though drainage schemes have helped. The nearby Oldbury Power Station means the area is crossed by a network of power lines. The market town of Thornbury serves the outlying villages and a new shopping precinct encourages people to come to the town, although some complain of a lack of parking spaces. The population of Thornbury is predominately young. Many work at the power station, Rolls Royce, Avonmouth or Britsh Aerospace. The presence of the M 4 motorway makes the area well suited to commuting.
